intro: Sedum ewersii, commonly known as Ewers' stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features fleshy, upright stems and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant has thick, water-storing leaves that help it survive in arid conditions. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its compact growth habit and vibrant floral display make it a popular choice for drought-tolerant landscaping.
